Context:
* A group of five students from George Brown College (GBC), namely Kate Armstrong, Christopher Caballero, Kieran Anson-Cartwright, Rofelyna King, and Karlee White, won the 2022 SAS Safe Roads Competition.
* The competition was a virtual event for college and university students from Canada and Mexico.
* Teams worked with open datasets from Toronto Police and Geotab to provide recommendations to improve road safety and reduce the risk of pedestrian fatalities.
* The City of Toronto has committed to the global Vision Zero strategy, which aims to eliminate all traffic fatalities and severe injuries and increase safe and equitable mobility, with a focus on vulnerable populations.
* Most collisions occurred during afternoon rush hour on Thursdays and Fridays.
* The highest growth rate of accidents was in residential and recreational areas.
* Red-light cameras in Toronto had an overall reduction on collisions.
* The team recommended specific locations in the city to install speed bumps and red-light cameras, as well as times for Toronto Police to deploy officers and vehicles in at-risk areas.
